title: Crack Salmon
ingredients: 1 bunch fresh scallions, green parts sliced and white parts cut into 1-inch-thick pieces
2 medium yellow bell peppers, cut into 1/2-inch-thick wedges
2 (8.8-ounce) packages microwaveable rice, cooked and warm
steps: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, add the soy sauce, the molasses, the ginger, the vinegar, and the garlic and cook, stirring often, until it comes to a simmer and reduces to about 1/2 cup, about 2 minutes.
Transfer the sauce mixture from the heat.
On a large rimmed baking sheet, place the white parts of the scallions, the sugar snap peas, and the bell peppers.
Drizzle the veggies with the oil and toss to coat. Spread the veggies out in an even layer.
Place the salmon fillets, skin-side down, nestled in the veggie mixture.
Sprinkle about 1 tablespoon of the sauce mixture over each of the salmon fillets.
Sprinkle the salmon fillets and the veggies with the salt and the pepper.
Bake the salmon fillets and the veggies until the fish reaches an internal temperature of 145 degrees F and the veggies are tender and lightly browned, about 16-18 minutes.
Plate the salmon fillets and the veggies over the cooked rice.
Serve the salmon fillets and the veggies drizzled with the remaining sauce mixture, sprinkled with the green onion slices and the sesame seeds, and with the lime wedges.

title: Easy Chicken Fajitas
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, optional
1 1/2 pounds chicken breasts, boneless and skinless, cut into thin strips
taco sauce, to taste, store-bought or homemade
salsa, to taste, store-bought or homemade
guacamole, to taste, store-bought or homemade
steps: In a large bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of the oil, the lemon juice, the seasoned salt, the dried oregano, the cumin, the garlic powder, the chili powder, the paprika, and the red pepper flakes.
Add the chicken strips to the seasoning mixture and turn to coat them.
Cover and refrigerate the chicken strips in the marinade for at least 1 hour.
In a large cast-iron or other heavy skillet over medium-high heat, heat the remaining oil.
Add the red pepper, the green pepper, the green onions, and the onion to the hot oil and sauté until crisp-tender, about 3-4 minutes.
Transfer the vegetable mixture from the skillet and keep them warm.
Drain the chicken strips and discard the marinade.
In the same skillet over medium-high heat, add the chicken strips and cook until they reach an internal temperature of 165 degrees F, about 5-6 minutes.
Return the vegetable mixture to the pan and heat through.
Spoon the filling mixture down the center of each of the tortillas.
Serve with your favorite optional toppings.

title: Slow N' Easy Short Ribs
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon salt, plus more, to taste
1/2 teaspoon pepper, plus more, to taste
4 fresh thyme sprigs, plus more, to taste, chopped, for garnish
2 cups dry red wine or beef broth
mashed potatoes, optional, to taste, cooked and warm, for serving
steps: Sprinkle the ribs with 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and 1/2 teaspoon of the pepper.
In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil.
Add the ribs in batches and cook until browned on all sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Transfer the ribs to a 4-5-quart slow cooker.
Add the carrots, the broth, 4 sprigs of the thyme, and the bay leaf to the slow cooker.
In the same skillet you used to brown the ribs and over medium heat, add the onions and cook, while stirring, until very tender and golden, about 8-9 minutes.
Add the garlic and the tomato paste and cook, while stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Stir in the wine and bring the sauce mixture to a boil.
Cook the sauce mixture until the liquid is reduced by half, about 8-10 minutes.
Add the sauce mixture to the slow cooker.
Cover the slow cooker and cook on low until the meat is tender, about 6-8 minutes.
Transfer the ribs and the vegetables from the slow cooker and keep them warm.
Transfer the sauce to a small saucepan and skim off the fat. Discard the thyme sprigs and the bay leaf.
Bring the sauce to a boil.
In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch and the water until smooth.
Stir the slurry into the sauce and bring the mixture to a boil.
Cook until thickened, about 1-2 minutes.
Taste the gravy for seasoning, adding the extra salt and the extra pepper as needed.
Serve the ribs and the vegetables over the warm mashed potatoes, topped with the gravy, and garnished with the extra thyme.

title: Maritime Pasta
ingredients: 1 pound medium-size raw shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 ounce (about 1/2 cup) parmesan cheese, shaved, for topping
steps: In a large pot of salted, boiling water, cook the pasta to al dente, according to the package directions. During the final 2 minutes of cooking time, add the shrimp and the peas to the boiling water.
Reserve 1/2 cup of the cooking water in a small heatproof bowl and drain the remaining liquid from the pasta mixture.
Return the pasta mixture to the pot.
Add the pesto, the salt, and the pepper to the pasta mixture and stir to combine.
Stir in the reserved cooking water, 1/4 cup at a time, until the desired sauce consistency is reached. You may not need to use all of the cooking liquid.
Transfer the pasta mixture to a serving bowl and sprinkle it with the parmesan.
Serve immediately.

title: Best Homemade Stromboli
ingredients: 1/2 cup pizza sauce, plus more, to taste, for serving
steps: Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F.
Line a large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
Spread the pizza dough on the prepared baking sheet to form a 10x16-inch rectangle.
Spread 1/2 cup of the pizza sauce over 2/3 of the dough lengthwise, leaving a 3-inch border of plain dough along one of the edges.
Evenly sprinkle 1/2 of the mozzarella cheese over the pizza sauce layer, then top with the salami and the ham.
Sprinkle the remaining mozzarella over the meat layer.
Brush 1/3 of the beaten egg over the plain border of dough.
Fold the two shorter sides of the dough in about 1-inch and brush with 1/2 of the remaining beaten egg.
Starting along the long edge with the toppings, tightly roll the dough up into a sphere.
Brush the entire stromboli with the remaining beaten egg.
Working lengthwise, gently cut 1-inch slats into the top of the stromboli, every 1-2 inches.
Sprinkle the parsley and the parmesan cheese over the stromboli.
Bake the stromboli in the lower third of the oven until it is bubbly and golden, about 8-10 minutes.
Transfer the stromboli from the oven and cool, about 5 minutes.
Slice and serve with the extra pizza sauce.

title: Steak Sandwich
ingredients: 1 cup flat-leaf parsley, firmly-packed, stems trimmed
1 tablespoon fresh oregano, can substitute 1 teaspoon dried oregano
2 tablespoons white wine vinegar, can substitute red wine vinegar
1/2 teaspoon salt, plus more, to taste
1/4 teaspoon black pepper, plus more, to taste
1 large French loaf bread, sliced into 5 equal pieces and split
5 medium lettuce leaves, of your choice
8 ounces roasted red peppers, homemade or store-bought
steps: Add the parsley, the oregano, and 4 of the garlic cloves to a food processor and pulse several times to finely chop.
Spoon the parsley mixture into a bowl.
Add the olive oil, the vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon of the salt, 1/4 teaspoon of the black pepper, and the red pepper flakes.
Taste the chimichurri for seasoning and adjust with the extra salt and the extra pepper as needed.
Let the steak rest at room temperature for 30 minutes.
Preheat the grill to 450 degrees F.
Rub the remaining 1 teaspoon of the salt, the remaining 1 teaspoon of the black pepper, and the remaining clove of the garlic over both sides of the steak.
Place the steak on the grill and cook until a brown jacket forms on the bottom, about 3-4 minutes.
Flip the steak and grill until the meat reaches an internal temperature of at least 135 degrees F, about 3-4 minutes.
Transfer the steak from the grill and allow it to rest for 5 minutes.
Slice the steak against the grain.
Toast or grill the French bread to your desired level of doneness.
Add an even amount of the steak slices, the lettuce, and the roasted red peppers to the bread.
Serve with the chimichurri.

title: Best Pub Sliders
ingredients: Dijon mustard, to taste, for serving
steps: Add the chicken, 12 ounces of the beer, the garlic, the salt, and the pepper to a slow cooker.
Cover the slow cooker and cook until the chicken is tender and cooked through, about 4 hours on high and 8 hours on low.
Transfer the chicken from the slow cooker and shred it with two forks.
Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F.
In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter.
Add the flour to the melted butter and cook, while whisking, until smooth and golden, about 2 minutes.
Add the remaining beer and the milk and cook, while whisking constantly, until the sauce is smooth and thick, about 5 minutes.
Reduce the heat to low.
Gradually add the cheddar to the sauce mixture, adding it in batches and stirring until the cheese is melted before adding more.
Add the chives and stir to combine.
Transfer the saucepan from the heat.
On a baking sheet, bake the pretzel rolls until warmed, about 10-15 minutes.
Spread the Dijon mustard on the inside of the top of each bun.
Place the chicken on the bottom of each bun and cover it generously with the cheese sauce.
Replace the tops of the buns and serve.

title: Frito-Pie Sloppy Joes
steps: Preheat the oven to broil.
Grease a 13×9-inch baking dish.
In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, add the beef and the onion and cook, while crumbling the meat, until the beef is no longer pink, about 7-10 minutes.
Tilt the saucepan and discard any of the excess grease with a spoon.
Add the garlic, the ancho chili powder, the chipotle chili powder, the cumin, and the paprika to the beef mixture and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes and their juices, the kidney beans and their liquid, the oregano, and the Worcestershire sauce to the beef mixture and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat and simmer the beef mixture, covered, about 10 minutes. Simmer longer if you prefer more of the liquid to cook off.
Add the salt and the pepper to the beef mixture and stir to combine. Transfer the saucepan from the heat.
Pour the chili in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
Cover the beef mixture with the corn chips, then sprinkle with the cheddar cheese.
Broil the beef mixture until the cheese has melted, about 1-2 minutes.
Evenly scoop the beef mixture onto each of the bottom buns, then top with the remaining top buns.
Serve.

title: Prime-Time Pasta
ingredients: 1 teaspoon sherry vinegar, can substitute white wine vinegar
scallions, to taste, finely sliced, for garnish
freshly cracked black pepper, to taste, for garnish
steps: In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook the pasta 1 minute less than al dente, according to the package directions.
In a large skillet over high heat, heat 1 tablespoon of the vegetable oil.
Add the mushrooms to the hot oil and sauté until browned, about 3-5 minutes.
Add the vinegar to the mushrooms and quickly toss to combine.
Transfer the mushrooms from the pan to a plate.
In a small bowl, add the red miso paste and the butter and whisk until a smooth, fluffy paste forms.
In a medium saucepan over medium heat, heat the remaining vegetable oil.
Add the garlic to the hot oil and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the sautéed mushrooms to the pan and toss to combine.
Add the miso-butter mixture and the heavy cream to the mushroom mixture and bring to a boil, while stirring gently.
Add the cooked pasta and stir until well-coated.
Add the salt and cook until the pasta is al dente, about 1-2 minutes.
Serve the pasta garnished with the scallions and the freshly cracked black pepper.

title: Yum-Yum Cauliflower Soup
ingredients: 1 medium head cauliflower, cut into florets
2 teaspoons chicken bouillon or 1 vegetable bouillon cube
steps: In a Dutch oven, combine the cauliflower, the carrot, the celery, the water, and the bouillon.
Bring the cauliflower mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low.
Cover and simmer the cauliflower mixture until the vegetables are tender, about 12-15 minutes. Do not drain the cauliflower mixture.
In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter.
Add the flour, the salt, and the pepper to the melted butter and cook, while stirring, until smooth.
Gradually add the milk to the flour mixture, while stirring or whisking.
Bring the milk mixture to a boil over medium heat.
Cook the milk mixture, while stirring, until thickened, about 2 minutes.
Reduce the heat to low.
Add the cheddar cheese and stir until melted.
Add the hot pepper sauce.
Stir the cheese mixture into the cauliflower mixture.
Serve.

title: Adobe Tortilla Soup
ingredients: 8 cups chicken stock, do not use broth
1 teaspoon salt, plus more, to taste
steps: Add the olive oil, 2 ounces of the tequila, the juice of 2 of the limes, the chipotle pepper, 1 tablespoon of the cumin, 1 tablespoon of the chili powder, 4 cloves of the garlic, 1 teaspoon of the oregano, 1 teaspoon of the salt, and 1 teaspoon of the pepper in a small food processor or blender and blend until smooth.
Put the marinade and the chicken thighs in a resealable plastic bag.
Seal the bag and refrigerate for at least 6 hours and up to 8 hours.
Preheat a grill or a grill pan to medium-high heat.
Add the jalapeño and grill until the skin is well-charred, about 4-5 minutes per side. Turn the grill off.
Transfer the jalapeño to a small bowl and cover it with plastic wrap to sweat the skin.
When it is cool enough to handle, remove the stem, the skin, and the seeds, then finely mince the jalapeño.
In a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil.
Add the onion to the hot oil and sauté until it starts to caramelize, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the remaining minced garlic, the minced jalapeño, 1 teaspoon of the chili powder, the remaining cumin, the salt, and the pepper.
Cook until very fragrant and the onions have caramelized, about 3-4 minutes. Be careful not to burn the mixture.
Deglaze the pan with about 1/4 of the chicken stock, scraping the bottom of the pan to release the browned bits.
Add the remaining chicken stock, the crushed tomatoes, and the remaining lime juice.
Add the tortilla strips from 1 of the tortillas and bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer the soup, uncovered, until flavors meld together, about 30 minutes.
Taste the soup for seasoning, adding more of the salt or the pepper as needed.
Preheat a grill or a grill pan to medium-high heat.
Transfer the chicken thighs from the marinade and place them on the grill.
Grill the chicken, while turning it, until it is cooked through with the meat reaching an internal temperature of 165 degrees F, about 14-18 minutes.
Transfer the chicken thighs to a large plate.
When cool enough to handle, remove the bones from the chicken and shred the meat. Keep the shredded chicken warm.
In a tall-sided skillet over medium-high heat, heat the remaining vegetable oil to 350 degrees F.
Add the remaining tortilla strips and fry until they are golden-brown, about 2-3 minutes.
Transfer the tortilla strips to a paper-towel-lined plate and season them with 1 teaspoon of the salt and the remaining chili powder.
Combine the sour cream, the remaining tequila, and the lime zest in a small bowl.
Season the tequila crema with the extra salt and the remaining black pepper.
Add the shredded chicken to the bottom of serving bowls and evenly pour the hot soup over top.
Top the soup with the diced avocado, the fried tortilla strips, the tequila crema, and the cilantro.
Serve garnished with the lime wedges.

ingredients: 8 cups romaine or iceberg lettuce, chopped

steps: In a skillet over medium heat, add the ground beef and cook, while crumbling, until it is no longer pink. Drain the excess grease.

In a large bowl, add the lettuce, the cooked beef, the corn, the tomatoes, the cheese, and the dressing and toss to coat.
Serve the salad topped with the corn chips.

title: Cactus Salad
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, plus more, to taste, for oiling the grill grates
2 (6-ounce) chicken breast halves, boneless and skinless
1 medium ear corn, husk and silk removed
1 (15-ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1/2 small red onion, sliced into petals
steps: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Using the extra olive oil, lightly oil the grill grates.
In a food processor, add the avocado, the sour cream, the mayonnaise, the water, the lime juice, the ranch seasoning, and the salt.
Blend the mixture until smooth.
Refrigerate the dressing until ready to use.
In a bowl, add the chicken, the remaining 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and the fajita seasoning and toss until evenly combined.
Add the chicken and the corn to the grill and cook, turning once, until the corn is tender and the chicken is cooked through to an internal temperature of 165 degrees F, about 10 minutes per side.
Transfer the chicken and the corn to a cutting board.
Divide the romaine, the tomatoes, the black beans, and the onions between two serving plates.
Cut the corn kernels off the cob and divide them between the two serving plates.
Slice the chicken breasts.
Divide the chicken between the serving plates.
Drizzle the salads with the avocado dressing.
Serve.

title: Cabbage Beef Soup
steps: Heat the oil in a large stockpot over medium-high heat.
Add the ground beef and the onion to the oil and cook, while crumbling the beef, until the meat is no longer pink and the onion is translucent, about 5-7 minutes. Drain the excess grease.
Transfer the beef mixture to a slow cooker.
Add the cabbage, the kidney beans, the tomato sauce, the water, the bouillon cubes, the cumin, the salt, and the pepper to the beef mixture and stir to combine.
Cover the slow cooker and cook, stirring occasionally, on low heat for 6-8 hours or high heat for 4 hours.
Serve.

title: Easy Chicken Stew
ingredients: 2 large russet potatoes, peeled and diced
steps: In a Dutch oven or soup pot over medium-high heat, add the oil, the butter, the onion, the celery, the carrots, and the garlic and sauté until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Stir the flour into veggie mixture and cook for 1 minute.
Stir the chicken broth into the veggie mixture until the flour has dissolved.
Add the heavy cream, the Italian seasoning, the mushrooms, the potatoes, and the chicken to the veggie mixture and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer the stew with the lid slightly open, stirring occasionally, for 25 minutes.
Take the chicken out of the stew and chop it up.
Add the chopped chicken to the stew and season with the salt and the pepper.
Serve.

title: 9-Ingredient Cabbage Soup
ingredients: 3 cups low-sodium chicken or vegetable broth
1 (14-ounce) can diced tomatoes with Italian seasonings
1 teaspoon salt, plus more, to taste
1/4 teaspoon pepper, plus more, to taste
steps: In a large soup pot over medium heat, heat the oil.
Add the cabbage, the carrots, the celery, and the onion and cook, while stirring often, until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the broth, the tomatoes and their juices, 1 teaspoon of the salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper and bring the mixture to a simmer.
Cover and reduce the heat to medium-low.
Simmer the mixture, while stirring occasionally, until all of the vegetables are tender, about 40 minutes-1 hour.
Season with the extra salt and the extra pepper as needed.
Serve.

title: Loaded Veggie Soup
ingredients: parsley, optional, to taste, chopped, for garnish
steps: Wash and pick through the lima beans for any bad ones.
Place the beans and the water in a large pot.
Season the beans with the salt and the pepper.
Bring the beans to a boil on the stovetop.
Reduce the heat and simmer, covered, until the beans are just tender, about 1 hour 20 minutes-2 hours.
Stir in the corn including the liquid in the can, the tomatoes and their juices, the potatoes, and the cabbage.
Simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Pour the soup into individual serving bowls.
Evenly divide the sour cream between the bowls and stir to combine.
Garnish with the parsley and serve.

title: Favorite Brie Salad
steps: Layer the mixed greens, the brie, the apple, the pecans, the cranberries, and the onions in a large salad bowl.
In a Mason jar, add the olive oil, the cider vinegar, the apple cider, the honey, the pepper, and the ginger.
Seal the jar and shake it vigorously.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad.
Serve.

title: King Breakfast Bake
ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more, to taste, for greasing the pan
1 loaf (18 slices) white sandwich bread, crusts removed and bread cut into 1-inch cubes
steps: Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with the extra butter.
In a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, melt 1 tablespoon of the butter.
Add the sausage to the melted butter and cook, while crumbling, until it is no longer pink, about 10 minutes.
Transfer the sausage to a large mixing bowl, leaving the drippings in the pan.
Return the pan to the heat and lower the heat to medium.
Add the onions and the remaining butter to the sausage drippings and cook, while stirring constantly, until the onions are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the onion to the sausage in the mixing bowl.
Add the bread cubes, the cheddar cheese, and the parsley to the sausage mixture and toss well to combine.
Spread the sausage mixture evenly into the prepared baking pan.
In a medium bowl, add the eggs, the half-and-half, the salt, and the pepper, and whisk to combine.
Pour the egg mixture evenly over the sausage mixture.
Cover the baking dish tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours and up to overnight.
Set the oven rack in the middle position.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Unwrap the casserole and bake until puffed and golden-brown, about 1 hour.
Slice and serve.

title: Fall Bubble-Up Bake
ingredients: 5 small apples, cored and thinly sliced
1 (17.5-ounce, 5-count) can refrigerated cinnamon rolls with icing
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Coat a 13x9-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
In a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter.
Add the apples to the butter and cook, stirring frequently, until they have softened and are beginning to brown, about 10-12 minutes.
Transfer the skillet from the heat.
In a large microwave-safe bowl, add the cream cheese and the powdered sugar and microwave on high heat, stirring every 30 seconds until softened, for 1 minute.
Transfer the bowl from the microwave and stir the cream cheese mixture until smooth. Slowly stir in the milk.
Stir the apple mixture into the cream cheese mixture.
Separate the cinnamon roll dough into five rolls and return its icing packet to the refrigerator.
Cut each of the cinnamon rolls into six pieces and stir them into the apple mixture.
Pour the apple mixture into the prepared baking dish.
Bake the apple bake until it is bubbling around the edges and the dough is baked through, about 26-32 minutes.
Let the apple bake stand for 10 minutes.
Squeeze the reserved icing packet into a quart-sized resealable plastic bag. Cut one corner with kitchen scissors, then drizzle over the apple bake.
Serve.

title: Mile High Bread
ingredients: 4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more, to taste, for dusting a work surface
10 tablespoons butter, cut into small cubes and frozen
steps: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine 4 cups of the flour, the salt, the baking powder, and the baking soda.
Add the butter cubes to the flour mixture and use a pastry cutter to cut them in until the mixture forms the consistency of small peas.
Create a well in the flour mixture and pour the buttermilk into it.
Mix the dough with a spoon or fork until it just holds together.
Dust the work surface with the extra flour and turn the dough out onto it.
Form the dough into a rectangle, then fold 1/3 of its sides to the center to create 3 layers.
Press the dough firmly to reform the rectangle shape to about 1 1/2-inches tall.
Bake the bread until it is cooked through and the top is brown, about 15-18 minutes.
Serve.

ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more, to taste, for dusting a work surface
steps: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, add 2 cups of the flour, 1/3 cup of the sugar, the baking powder, and the salt and stir to combine.
Create a well in the flour mixture and pour the heavy cream into the center.
Mix the dough mixture until it holds together but isn't overly sticky.
Dust a work surface with the extra flour and place the dough onto the floured surface.
Divide the dough in half and form it into discs about 1 1/2-2 inches tall.
Cut the discs like a pizza into 6 triangles.
Transfer the scones to the prepared baking sheet.
Bake the scones until the centers are set and the edges start to brown, about 12-14 minutes.
While the scones are baking, in a small bowl, add the cinnamon and the remaining sugar and mix to combine.
Let the scones cool for 5 minutes.
Evenly sprinkle the cinnamon-sugar over the scones to coat.
Serve.

title: Farmer's Wife Breakfast
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups frozen cubed hash brown potatoes, thawed
bacon, to taste, cooked and crumbled
steps: In a bowl, whisk the eggs, the milk, the parsley, and the salt together.
In a 9-inch cast-iron or other heavy skillet over medium heat, cook the sausage, while crumbling, until it is no longer pink
Transfer the sausage from the skillet and drain the excess grease.
In same skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the potatoes and the onion to the butter and cook, while stirring, until both are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the cooked sausage to the potato mixture.
Add the egg mixture to the sausage mixture and cook, while stirring, until the eggs are almost set.
Sprinkle the egg mixture with the cheese.
Cover the skillet and cook the breakfast skillet until the cheese has melted, about 1-2 minutes.
Serve the breakfast skillet topped with the bacon, the chives, and the tomatoes.

title: Fall-In-Love Breakfast Bake
ingredients: 1 cup 2% milk, plus more, to taste, for serving
3/4 cup brown sugar, packed, plus more, to taste, for serving
steps: Grease a 7x11-inch baking dish.

In a large bowl, add the eggs, the oats, the pumpkin, 1 cup of the milk, 3/4 cup of the brown sugar, the cranberries, the butter, the baking powder, the vanilla, the ground nutmeg, the salt, and the cloves and mix to combine.
Transfer the oat mixture to the prepared baking dish.
Cover and refrigerate the baking dish for at least 8 hours and up to overnight.
Let the baking dish sit at room temperature for 30 minutes prior to baking.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Uncover and stir the oat mixture.
Sprinkle the oat mixture with the pecans.
Bake until the oat mixture reaches an internal temperature of 160 degrees F, about 30-35 minutes.
Serve warm with the extra milk and the extra brown sugar.

title: Bacon Breakfast Rolls
ingredients: 1/2 cup warm water, about 120-130 degrees F
1/2 cup warm milk, about 120-130 degrees F
3 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more, to taste, for the dough and for dusting a work surface
1/2 cup plus 1/4 cup butter, melted, divided
8 ounces bacon, cooked crisp and crumbled
steps: Using the oil, coat the inside of a glass bowl and set it aside
In a small bowl, dissolve the yeast in the warm water. Set the yeast mixture aside to bloom.
In the bowl of a stand mixer with the dough hook attachment, add the warm milk, the sugar, 1/3 cup of the melted butter, the salt, and the egg and mix to combine.
Add 2 cups of the flour to the milk mixture and mix until smooth.

Alternate adding the yeast mixture and the remaining 1 1/2 cups of the flour to the dough mixture, mixing until smooth after each addition. Add the extra flour, a little at a time, if needed until the desired consistency is reached.
Using the extra flour, lightly dust a work surface, and then turn the dough out onto the floured surface. Knead for 5 minutes.
Place the dough in the oiled bowl and cover it.
Let the dough rise in a warm, draft-free place until it has doubled in size, about 2 hours-2 hours 30 minutes.
Punch the dough down.
Roll out or press the dough into a 9x15-inch rectangle, about 1/4-inch-thick.
Spread 1/2 cup of the melted butter all over one side of the dough.
Sprinkle the brown sugar, the cinnamon, and the bacon crumbles evenly over the buttered-side of the dough.
Beginning on the long side of the dough, roll the dough into a log, pinching the seam and the ends to seal it.
Cut the dough log into 12 even slices.
Pour the remaining 1/4 cup of the melted butter into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Place the sliced rolls in the pan so that they are almost touching and allow them to rise until they double in size, about 45 minutes-1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Bake the rolls until they are golden-brown, about 25 minutes.
Whisk the maple syrup and the confectioners' sugar together until smooth.
Allow the rolls to cool for 4-5 minutes.
Drizzle the glaze over the warm rolls.
Serve warm.

title: Breakfast Fajitas
ingredients: freshly ground black pepper, to taste
steps: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Lightly coat a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
Place the red bell peppers, the orange bell peppers, and the green bell peppers in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
Add the olive oil, the chili powder, the lime juice, the garlic, the cumin, the paprika, and the onion powder to the peppers and toss them gently to combine.
Season the bell peppers with the salt and the black pepper.
Roast the bell peppers until tender, about 12-15 minutes.
Transfer the baking sheet from the oven and make six wells in between the bell peppers.
Add 1 of the eggs to each of the wells, gently cracking the eggs to keep the yolks intact.
Season the eggs with the salt and the pepper.
Bake until the egg whites have set, about 8-12 minutes.
Serve immediately with the avocado and the cilantro.

title: Fall's Best Muffins
steps: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Line a 12-cup muffin pan with muffin liners.
In a large bowl, whisk the pumpkin purée and the eggs together.
Whisk in the sugar, the brown sugar, the oil, and the milk.
Sift the flour, the baking powder, baking soda, and the salt into the pumpkin mixture and fold until just combined.
Scoop 1/4 cup of the batter into each prepared muffin cup.
Add a scant 1/2 teaspoon of the pumpkin spice to each muffin cup and use a toothpick to swirl the spice into the batter.
Top each muffin cup with 1 rounded tablespoon of the remaining batter and smooth it over the top.
Bake the muffins for 5 minutes.
Reduce the heat to 350 degrees F.
Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 15-20 minutes.
Let the muffins cool completely in the pan, about 1 hour.
Serve.

title: World's Best Apple Crisp
ingredients: 10 cups apples, peeled and cored, sliced
1 cup plus 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, divided
vanilla ice cream, optional, to taste, for serving
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Place the apples in an ungreased 9x13-inch baking dish.
In a small bowl, add the white sugar, 1 tablespoon of the flour, and the cinnamon and mix to combine.
Sprinkle the sugar mixture over the apples.
Pour the water over the apple mixture.
In a large bowl, add the oats, the remaining flour, the brown sugar, the baking powder, and the baking soda and mix to combine.
Add the melted butter to the oat mixture and mix with a fork until it is crumbly.
Sprinkle the oat mixture over the apple mixture.
Bake the apple crisp until the top is golden-brown and the apples are bubbling around the edges, about 45 minutes.
Serve the apple crisp with the vanilla ice cream.

title: Irish Apple Cake
ingredients: 1 stick butter, cold and cut into small cubes, plus more, to taste, softened, for greasing the pan
3 cups plus 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, divided
1 large Granny Smith apple, thinly sliced into 1/4-inch pieces
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9-inch springform pan with the extra butter and line the sides and bottom with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk 3 cups of the flour, the baking powder, the salt, the ginger, the cinnamon, the allspice, the nutmeg, and 1 cup of the sugar together.
Add the remaining 1 stick of cold butter to the flour mixture and mix by hand until no large pieces remain and the mixture resembles sand.
In a separate medium bowl, add 3 of the large eggs, 1 cup of the heavy cream, and 2 teaspoons of the vanilla and whisk together.
Add the wet mixture to the dry mixture and stir with a rubber spatula until just combined.
In a third medium bowl, add the apples and the remaining flour and toss until evenly coated.
Fold the apples into the batter.
Pour the cake batter into the prepared pan and sprinkle with the demerara sugar.
Bake the cake until the apples are very tender and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour 20 minutes.
Transfer to a wire rack and allow the cake to cool in the pan completely, about 30 minutes.
In a heatproof bowl, add the remaining sugar and the egg yolks and whisk until it has lightened in color, about 6 minutes.
In a medium, heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium-low heat, add the remaining heavy cream to the sugar mixture and cook, watching carefully, until it is just boiling.
Transfer the saucepan from the heat, add the remaining vanilla extract, and stir until combined.
Slowly pour the hot cream mixture into the sugar mixture, while whisking constantly.
Pour the custard mixture into the same saucepan over medium-low heat and cook, stirring constantly, until just thickened. Avoid boiling.
Transfer from the saucepan away from the heat and pour it through a fine-mesh strainer into a bowl and let cool, about 10-15 minutes.
Pour the custard sauce over the cooled cake.
Slice and serve the cake drizzled with more of the custard sauce.

title: Brown Sugar Butter Cookies
ingredients: 1/2 cup white granulated sugar, optional, for rolling
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a nonstick baking mat.
In the bowl of a stand mixer with the paddle attachment, add the butter and the brown sugar and cream until combined.
Scrape down the sides of the bowl and mix the butter and the brown sugar again.
Add the egg and the vanilla and mix until well-combined.
In a separate bowl, add the flour, the salt, and the baking powder and whisk to combine.
Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and stir until just combined.
Using a cookie scoop, scoop out 1 1/2-tablespoon-sized portions of the dough and roll them into balls.
Roll the dough balls in the granulated sugar.
Place the dough balls on the prepared cookie sheet and press them down with the tines of a fork.
Refrigerate the dough balls for at least 30 minutes and up to 1 hour.
Bake until the centers of the cookies are set, about 10-12 minutes.
Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 3-4 minutes.
Transfer the cookies to a wire rack to cool completely.
Serve.

Pour the custard mixture into the same saucepan over medium-low heat and cook, stirring constantly, until just thickened. Avoid boiling.
Transfer from the saucepan away from the heat and pour it through a fine-mesh strainer into a bowl and let cool, about 10-15 minutes.
Pour the custard sauce over the cooled cake.
Slice and serve the cake drizzled with more of the custard sauce.

title: Brown Sugar Butter Cookies
ingredients: 1/2 cup white granulated sugar, optional, for rolling
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a nonstick baking mat.
In the bowl of a stand mixer with the paddle attachment, add the butter and the brown sugar and cream until combined.
Scrape down the sides of the bowl and mix the butter and the brown sugar again.
Add the egg and the vanilla and mix until well-combined.
In a separate bowl, add the flour, the salt, and the baking powder and whisk to combine.
Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and stir until just combined.
Using a cookie scoop, scoop out 1 1/2-tablespoon-sized portions of the dough and roll them into balls.
Roll the dough balls in the granulated sugar.
Place the dough balls on the prepared cookie sheet and press them down with the tines of a fork.
Refrigerate the dough balls for at least 30 minutes and up to 1 hour.
Bake until the centers of the cookies are set, about 10-12 minutes.
Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 3-4 minutes.
Transfer the cookies to a wire rack to cool completely.
Serve.

title: Birthday Loaf
ingredients: flour, to taste, for dusting the pans
1/2 cup vanilla frosting, homemade or store-bought
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease the bottoms of two 8x4-inch loaf pans, then lightly dust the greased pan bottoms with the flour.

In a large bowl, add the cake mix, the pudding mix, the water, the oil, and the eggs and beat with an electric mixer on medium speed, scraping down the sides occasionally, until combined, about 2 minutes.
Add 1/4 cup of the sprinkles to the batter and stir to combine.
Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans.
Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45-50 minutes.
Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes.
Run a metal spatula around the edges of the loaves to loosen them from the pans, then transfer the loaves to a cooling rack.
Allow the cakes to cool completely, about 1 hour.
Spread the frosting on top of the loaves.
Sprinkle the loaves evenly with the remaining sprinkles.
Slice and serve.

title: Pumpkin Pie Dump Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9x13-inch pan.
In a large bowl, add the pumpkin purée, the evaporated milk, the eggs, the brown sugar, and the white sugar and stir to combine.
Stir the cinnamon, the ginger, the cloves, and the salt into the pumpkin mixture.
Pour the pumpkin mixture into the prepared pan.
Sprinkle the dry cake mix evenly over the pumpkin mixture.
Sprinkle the pecans over the cake mix.
Drizzle the melted butter over the top of the pecan layer.
Bake until the edges are lightly browned, about 50 minutes-1 hour.
Allow the cake to cool.
Serve.

title: Cinnamon Swirl Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
In a large bowl, add 2 3/4 cups of the flour, the granulated sugar, the baking powder, and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and mix together.
Make a well in the middle of the flour mixture.

Add the melted ice cream, the eggs, and 1/4 cup of the melted butter and stir until smooth and thick, but easy to stir. Add 1-2 tablespoons of the extra milk at a time, if needed, until the batter is thinner and reaches the desired consistency.
In a small bowl, combine the remaining softened butter, the brown sugar, the remaining flour, and the cinnamon.
Spread the batter evenly into the prepared baking dish.
Dollop the cinnamon mixture by the tablespoonful over the batter, then run a butter knife through it to create a swirl effect.
Bake the cake until a toothpick inserted into the middle comes out clean, about 25-30 minutes.
While the cake is baking, add the powdered sugar in a bowl with the remaining 1/4 cup of the milk, the vanilla, and the remaining salt and whisk until smooth.
Let the cake cool for 10 minutes.
Pour the glaze over the cake while it is still warm.
Slice and serve.

title: Chocolate Pretzel Bars
ingredients: 5 cups whole mini pretzels, for crushing, plus 24 whole mini pretzels, for topping, divided
steps: Line a 9x13-inch baking pan with parchment paper.
Crush 5 cups of the pretzels into small crumbs by placing them in a resealable bag and rolling them over with a rolling pin, or by pulsing them in a food processor.
In a bowl, add the pretzel crumbs, 2 cups of the peanut butter, the powdered sugar, and the melted butter and mix until evenly combined.
Spread the pretzel mixture into the bottom of the prepared baking pan.
In a microwave-safe dish, add the chocolate chips and the remaining peanut butter and microwave in increments of about 30 seconds, stirring in between each, until the mixture is melted.
Spread the chocolate-peanut butter mixture over the top of the pretzel mixture.
Press the remaining 24 whole pretzels lightly into the chocolate-peanut butter layer, 4 down and 6 across, so they'll be centered on each bar when cut.
Chill the bars for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Cut the bars into 24 pieces.
Serve.

title: Cake Mix Cookies
ingredients: 1 (15.25-ounce) box cake mix, of your choice
1/2 scant cup vegetable oil or 7 tablespoons butter, melted
candy pieces or chocolate chips, optional, of your choice, to taste
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Line a baking sheet with a silicone mat or parchment paper.
In a large bowl, stir the cake mix, the oil, and the eggs until combined.
Optionally, cover the dough and refrigerate until somewhat set, about 15-20 minutes.
Using a medium scoop or a spoon, scoop the dough onto the prepared baking sheet.
Top the dough scoops with the candy pieces.
Bake until the cookies are set, about 9-11 minutes. Do not let them brown.
Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for 5-10 minutes.
Transfer the cookies to a wire rack to cool completely.
Serve.

title: Caramel Apple Dip
ingredients: apples, to taste, sliced, for serving
steps: In a medium bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth and creamy.
Add the sugar and beat until thoroughly combined.
Spread the cream cheese mixture into an even layer in a 3-cup serving dish.
Pour the caramel dip over the cream cheese mixture and spread it into an even layer.
Top the caramel layer with the toffee bits.
Serve with the sliced apples.

title: Shirley Temple Party Punch
ingredients: 32 maraschino cherries, stems removed, plus more, to taste, for garnish
6 cups orange juice, no pulp, chilled
orange slices, to taste, for garnish
steps: In two (16-cube) ice cube trays, add 1 maraschino cherry to each slot and then fill the trays with water.
Transfer the ice trays to the freezer and let freeze, about 2 hours.
Add the cherry ice cubes to a punch bowl and pour the grenadine over the ice cubes.
Add the orange juice, the lemon-lime soda, and the ginger ale to the grenadine mixture and gently stir to combine.
Add the orange slices and the extra maraschino cherries to the punch mixture.
With a ladle, pour the punch into glasses or cups and serve.

title: Fall Old-Fashioned
ingredients: orange peel, to taste, for garnish
steps: In a cocktail shaker, add the ice, the bourbon, the orange liqueur, the maple syrup, the pumpkin purée, and the bitters and shake well.
Double strain the old-fashioned through a fine mesh strainer into a chilled glass filled with more of the ice.
Serve the old-fashioned garnished with the orange peel.

title: Apple Cider Spritz
ingredients: apple wedges, to taste, for garnish
steps: Fill a glass with the ice.
Pour the apple cider and the Aperol over the ice and stir.
Add the prosecco and the soda water to the cider mixture and stir.
Serve the drink sprinkled with the cinnamon and garnished with the apple wedges.

title: Best Rum Punch
steps: In a large pitcher, add the white rum, the spiced rum, the coconut rum, the pineapple rum, the pineapple juice, the mango-orange juice, the grenadine, the pineapple chunks, and the lime juice.
Add the orange wedges to the punch and stir to combine.
Serve the rum punch over the ice in cocktail glasses.

title: Top-Rated Margarita
ingredients: lime wheels, to taste, for garnish
steps: In a large pitcher, add the tequila, the triple sec, and the sweet and sour mix and stir to combine.
In a bowl wide enough to accommodate the rims of the glasses, add the lime juice.
On a small plate, add the salt.
Dip the rims of the glasses into the lime juice, and then into the salt.
Add the ice to the prepared glasses.
Pour the margarita mix over the ice and garnish with the lime wheels.
Serve.

title: Fall Latte
ingredients: whipped cream, to taste, store-bought or homemade, for garnish
pecans, optional, to taste, toasted and chopped, for garnish
steps: In a small pot over medium-high heat, combine the maple syrup, the pecan butter, the brown sugar, and the butter.
Cook the maple-pecan mixture, while stirring, until the sugar is completely dissolved, about 2 minutes.
Transfer the sauce mixture off the heat and whisk in the heavy cream and the vanilla extract.
Set the maple-pecan syrup aside to cool completely.
Combine the espresso and 2 tablespoons of the reserved maple-pecan syrup in a mug, whisking until well-blended.
Pour in the steamed milk.
Top the latte with the whipped cream and the chopped pecans.
Serve.

title: Best Strawberry Milkshake
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups strawberries, washed and dried, halved
whipped cream, optional, to taste, for topping
chocolate shavings, optional, to taste, for topping
steps: Place two glasses in the freezer for about 10 minutes.
Place the halved strawberries, the ice cream, and the milk in the blender and blend until combined, about 10-12 seconds.
Divide the milkshake between the prepared glasses.
Serve the milkshakes topped with the whipped cream and the chocolate shavings.

title: Witches' Brew
ingredients: 1/2 cup fresh mint leaves, plus more, to taste, for garnish
steps: In a small saucepan, bring the sugar and the water to a boil.
Cook the sugar water, while stirring, until the sugar has dissolved.
Let the simple syrup cool.
Place the kiwis, 1/2 cup of the mint, and the simple syrup in a blender, cover, and process until blended.
Pour the kiwi mixture into a large pitcher and stir in the vodka.
Refrigerate the kiwi mixture until it is chilled, for at least 2 hours and up to overnight.
Stir the ginger ale into the kiwi mixture just before serving.
Serve the Witches' Brew over the ice, garnished with the extra mint.

title: Purple-People-Eater Punch
steps: Pour the grape juice and the food coloring into a 6-quart punch bowl and stir to combine.
Slowly pour the club soda into the grape juice mixture.
Gently spoon the ice cream into the punch mixture and whisk to swirl.
Serve the punch in glasses and garnish with the sprinkles.
